history.content:
Taking CS70 over the summer is not really all that easy. The tests are about the same difficulty as tests over the school year. The main argument for why 70 is easier over summer is that it is your only class and thus your only real focus. On the other hand, there is a lot of new material in 70 and it can be hard to get a grasp on so quickly which is why people don't take it over summer. Both points are valid and it depends if you prefer time but more workload overall. 

--

Just to add on to this because I took CS 70 over the summer (best decision for me). There is a lot of time during the summer since you are only taking one class and most school extracurriculars are suspended (besides AFX summer), so you have time to do the homework/study/focus. That being said, there are a ton of resources for CS 70 over the summer specifically OH and HW parties that you now have the time to go to and truly understand the material with the help of TAs/AIs.

Taking CS70 over the summer is not really all that easy. The tests are about the same difficulty as tests over the school year. The main argument for why 70 is easier over summer is that it is your only class and thus your only real focus. On the other hand, there is a lot of new material in 70 and it can be hard to get a grasp on so quickly which is why people don't take it over summer. Both points are valid and it depends if you prefer time but more workload overall.

In general are the students taking CS 70 in the summer taking it ambitiously to get ahead, or because they are not confident enough to take it in the fall? Several people have said that it's supposedly easier in the summer but easy is relative, right?
history.subject: CS 70 Summer Cohort
